properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 24 at 7:50PM CST until January 26 at 9:00PM CST by NWS Chicago IL
properties.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in
Illinois...

Fox River at Dayton affecting La Salle County

The Flood Warning continues for
The Fox River at Dayton, or from Millington downstream to confluence
with the Illinois River.
* At  645 PM Friday the stage was 13.0 feet and was ice affected.
* Flood stage is 12.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring and Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river will likely remain above flood stage through
the weekend while the ice jam remains in place. Additional water level fluctuations are likely. Ice jams can result in rapid rises in water levels with little or no warning.
* Impact...Ice jam flooding is often very localized and may not impact
all areas along the river at the same time or to the same level of
severity.
properties.instruction:
Safety message...If you encounter a flooded roadway...turn around and
find an alternate route.

Ice jams may cause rapid fluctuations in water levels with little or
no warning. During ice jam flooding, not all locations may experience
impacts at the same time or to the same level of severity. Movement
of river ice may cause additional flooding into areas not currently
experiencing impacts. Residents near the river should remain alert
for possible flooding.
